intro: Rosa canina var. felekensis, commonly known as the Feketé barackfa, is a variant of the dog rose native to parts of Eastern Europe. It is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant produces bright red hips, which are rich in vitamin C and used in traditional medicine. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun, making it suitable for hedges or ornamental gardens. This variety is noted for its hardiness and ability to adapt to various environmental conditions.
